intro: Struthanthus inornus, commonly known as the plain thornpoppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related genera. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Struthanthus inornus is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing several seeds.
